events.message: Customer reported a car collision that occurred on the morning of April 29, resulting in moderate damage to the front bumper and left headlight.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report and confirming the involvement of a personal vehicle.
An agent specializing in auto accident claims was assigned promptly to ensure customer concerns are addressed effectively and timely.
Official acknowledgment of the claim sent to the customer with details on the next steps and estimated timeline for processing.
Request made for additional documents including accident police report, photographs of the vehicle damage, and driver's insurance information.
Customer submitted all requested documents including the police report, photos, and a copy of their driver’s license as instructed.
Investigation into the accident circumstances commenced, involving examination of submitted evidence and contacting involved parties.
Investigation concluded with confirmation that the customer’s vehicle was damaged due to a third-party driver’s fault.
A settlement amount was proposed to the customer covering repairs and rental car reimbursement for the duration of the vehicle fix.
Customer confirmed acceptance of the proposed settlement and expressed gratitude for the efficient handling of their claim.
Approval process completed and claim status updated to approved following customer’s acceptance and confirmation of documented repair estimates.
Settlement payment was issued to the customer’s account and notification sent confirming the transaction along with payment details.
Claim was officially closed after confirming payment receipt and customer satisfaction with the resolution of their auto accident case.
All case files and correspondence were archived in the company’s secure record system for future reference and compliance requirements.
